question: What percentage of human genes have no introns?
ideal_answer: About 3% of human genes have no introns.  URL_0

snippets.text: Intronless genes (IGs) constitute approximately 3% of the human genome.
Intronless genes (IGs) fraction varies between 2.7 and 97.7% in eukaryotic genomes.
608 of these genes have intronless human orthologs
Intronless genes, which constitute 3 percent of the human genome, differ from intron-containing genes in evolution and function.
